content.question: An airplane flies horizontally at a constant velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> relative to the ground over a stationary observer. The plane releases one package when it is located a horizontal distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> to the left of the observer, and then releases a second package when it is located a horizontal distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> to the right of the observer, as shown in the figure. The observer measures the first package to have a speed of <math alttext="v sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> when released, and the second package to have a speed of <math alttext="v sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> when released. Which of the following statements correctly compares <math alttext="v sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ?
